009package Ch08_Binary_Regions;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.color.iterate.ColorSequencer;
018import imagingbook.common.color.iterate.FiniteLinearColorSequencer;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.moments.FlusserMoments;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
022import imagingbook.common.math.MahalanobisDistance;
023import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
024import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
025import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegionSegmentation;
026import imagingbook.common.regions.RegionContourSegmentation;
027import imagingbook.common.util.tuples.Tuple2;
028import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
029import imagingbook.sampleimages.kimia.Kimia1070;
030import imagingbook.sampleimages.kimia.KimiaCollage;
031
032import java.awt.Color;
033import java.awt.Font;
034import java.util.ArrayList;
035import java.util.Comparator;
036import java.util.List;
037
038/**
039 * <p>
040 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of complex invariant Flusser moments for 2D shape matching. It opens a
041 * special binary input image (collage of shapes), where the top row are the reference shapes. They are assigned
042 * different colors. All other shapes are compared to the reference shapes and colored with the color of the most
043 * similar reference shape. See Sec. 8.6.5 of [1] for additional details.
044 * </p>
045 * <p>
046 * The plugin offers two options for finding the "closest" reference moment vector for a given shape:
047 * <br>
048 * (a) Mahalonobis distance (MD, see Eq. 8.57 and Sec. G.3 of [1]): The MD is calculated from the (pre-calculated)
049 * covariance matrix of the moment vectors of the entire 'Kimia1070' dataset to obtain representative statistical shape
050 * parameters. The MD compensates the large magnitude variation between the 11 moment space dimensions.
051 * <br>
052 * (b) Euclidean distance (ED): Here the distance between moment vectors is measured using the ED. The large-magnitude
053 * moment elements obviously dominate this quantity. Typically only the 3-4 largest moments are actually used, all
054 * others have no effect. Thus results with the ED are inferior to the ones obtained with the MD.
055 * <br>
056 * In both cases matching is performed linearly, i.e., a given moment vector is simply compared to all reference
057 * vectors.
058 * </p>
059 * <p>
060 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
061 * (2022).
062 * </p>
063 *
064 * @author WB
065 * @version 2023/01/02
066 * @see Flusser_Moments_Covariance_Matrix
067 */
068public class Flusser_Moments_Matching_Demo implements PlugIn {
069
070    private static final ImageResource ir = KimiaCollage.ShapeCollage1;
071    private static final int ReferenceBoundaryY = 130;    // everything above this position is a reference shape
072
073    private static int MinRegionSize = 100;
074    private static boolean UseMahalanobisDistance = true;
075    private static double MaxMomentDistance = 1.0;
076
077    private static final int FontSize = 20;
078    private static final Color UnmatchedColor = Color.gray;
079    private static final Color[] ReferenceShapeColors = {Color.yellow, Color.green, Color.cyan, Color.magenta, Color.pink};
080    private static final Font MarkerFont = new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.BOLD, 14);
081    private static final Color MarkerColor = Color.white;
082
083    private static final String MomentKey = "mts";
084    private static final String LabelKey = "lbl";
085
086    private MahalanobisDistance md;     // new MahalanobisDistance(cov);
087    private double[][] U;               // md.getWhiteningTransformation();
088
089    @Override
090    public void run(String str) {
091        ImagePlus im = ir.getImagePlus();
092        im.show();
093        if (!runDialog()) {
094            return;
095        }
096
097        // segment the image into binary regions
098        ByteProcessor ip = (ByteProcessor) im.getProcessor();
099        BinaryRegionSegmentation segmenter = new RegionContourSegmentation((ByteProcessor) ip);
100        List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions(true);
101        if (regions.isEmpty()) {
102            IJ.log("No regions found!");
103            return;
104        }
105
106        // calculate invariant moment for all regions
107        // and split into reference/other shapes
108        List<BinaryRegion> refShapes = new ArrayList<BinaryRegion>();
109        List<BinaryRegion> othShapes = new ArrayList<BinaryRegion>();
110        for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
111            if (r.getSize() > MinRegionSize) {
112                // calculate invariant Flusser moments for region r
113                double[] moments = new FlusserMoments(r).getInvariantMoments();
114                r.setProperty(MomentKey, moments);
115                if (r.getCenter().getY() < ReferenceBoundaryY)
116                    refShapes.add(r);
117                else
118                    othShapes.add(r);
119            }
120        }
121
122        // sort reference shapes by center x-coordinates and assign labels:
123        refShapes.sort(Comparator.comparingDouble(r -> r.getCenter().getX()));
124        {
125            int k = 0;
126            for (BinaryRegion r : refShapes) {
127                r.setProperty(LabelKey, "R" + k);
128                k++;
129            }
130        }
131
132        // sort other shapes by center y-coordinates and assign labels:
133        othShapes.sort(Comparator.comparingDouble(r -> r.getCenter().getY()));
134        {
135            int k = 0;
136            for (BinaryRegion s : othShapes) {
137                s.setProperty(LabelKey, "S" + k);
138                k++;
139            }
140        }
141
142        if (UseMahalanobisDistance) {
143            // Matrix.fromLongBits(Kimia1070.covarianceRegionBits);
144            double[][] cov = Matrix.fromLongBits(Kimia1070.covarianceRegionBits);
145            md = new MahalanobisDistance(cov);
146            // U = md.getWhiteningTransformation();
147        }
148
149        // ----- perform matching and create output image -------
150
151        ColorProcessor cp = new ColorProcessor(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight());
152        ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
153        ola.setFont(MarkerFont);
154        ola.setTextColor(MarkerColor);
155        ColorSequencer randomColor = new FiniteLinearColorSequencer(ReferenceShapeColors);
156
157        // process reference shapes
158        Color[] refColors = new Color[refShapes.size()];
159        double[][] refMoments = new double[refShapes.size()][];
160        {
161            int k = 0;
162            for (BinaryRegion r : refShapes) {
163                refMoments[k] = (double[]) r.getProperty(MomentKey);
164                refColors[k] = randomColor.next();
165                paintRegion(r, cp, refColors[k]);
166                markRegion(r, ola, (String) r.getProperty(LabelKey));
167                k++;
168            }
169        }
170
171        // process other shapes
172        for (BinaryRegion s : othShapes) {
173            double[] moments = (double[]) s.getProperty(MomentKey);
174            // find best-matching reference shape
175            Tuple2<Integer, Double> match = (UseMahalanobisDistance) ?
176                    findBestMatchMahalanobis(moments, refMoments) :
177                    findBestMatchEuclidean(moments, refMoments);
178            int k = match.get0();
179            double dist = match.get1();
180            Color col = (dist <= MaxMomentDistance) ? refColors[k] : UnmatchedColor;
181            paintRegion(s, cp, col);
182            markRegion(s, ola, (String) s.getProperty(LabelKey));
183        }
184
185        ImagePlus imResult = new ImagePlus("Matched Regions", cp);
186        imResult.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
187        imResult.show();
188    }
189
190    /**
191     * Finds the reference moment vector closest to the given sample moment vector and returns the associated index (k)
192     * and distance (d).
193     *
194     * @param moments a sample moment vector
195     * @param refMoments an array of reference moment vectors
196     * @return a pair (k, d) consisting of reference index k and min. vector distance d
197     */
198    private Tuple2<Integer, Double> findBestMatchEuclidean(double[] moments, double[][] refMoments) {
199        int iMin = -1;
200        double dMin = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
201        for (int i = 0; i < refMoments.length; i++) {
202            double d = Matrix.distL2(moments, refMoments[i]);    // Euclidean distance
203            if (d < dMin) {
204                dMin = d;
205                iMin = i;
206            }
207        }
208        return new Tuple2<>(iMin, dMin);
209    }
210
211    private Tuple2<Integer, Double> findBestMatchMahalanobis(double[] moments, double[][] refMoments) {
212        int iMin = -1;
213        double dMin = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
214        for (int i = 0; i < refMoments.length; i++) {
215            double d = md.distance(moments, refMoments[i]);    // Euclidean distance
216            if (d < dMin) {
217                dMin = d;
218                iMin = i;
219            }
220        }
221        return new Tuple2<>(iMin, dMin);
222    }
223
224    private void markRegion(BinaryRegion r, ShapeOverlayAdapter ola, String s) {
225        Pnt2d c = r.getCenter();
226        ola.addText(c.getX(), c.getY(), s);
227    }
228
229    private void paintRegion(BinaryRegion r, ColorProcessor cp, Color col) {
230        cp.setColor(col);
231        for (Pnt2d p : r) {
232            cp.drawDot(p.getXint(), p.getYint());
233        }
234    }
235
236    // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
237
238    private boolean runDialog() {
239        GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
240        gd.addNumericField("Minimum region size", MinRegionSize, 0);
241        gd.addNumericField("Uax. moment vector distance", MaxMomentDistance, 3);
242        gd.addCheckbox("Use Mahalanobis distance", UseMahalanobisDistance);
243
244        gd.showDialog();
245        if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
246            return false;
247        }
248
249        MinRegionSize = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
250        MaxMomentDistance = gd.getNextNumber();
251        UseMahalanobisDistance = gd.getNextBoolean();
252        return true;
253    }
254
255}
256
